columns.text: In this problem, we will determine the break-even price for the given situation based on the equivalent annual cost of the equipments.

The break-even price refers to the price wherein no profit nor loss is being made. This means that whatever investment you put in, is the same amount of gain you obtain. In this situation, in order to solve the break-even point, we will equate the equivalent annual cost of the two assets.

Cross-multiply the two fractions to get rid of the values in the denominator:

$$\begin{aligned}
9.99512\times(52.065 \times \text{cost}-\$0.45)&=1.7355\times(0.874573 \times \text{cost}-\$2.25)\\[15 pt]
520.065\times \text{cost}-\$4.498&=0.1518\times \text{cost}-\$3.905
\end{aligned}$$

Isolate the terms with the variable then combine the like terms:

$$\begin{aligned}
52.065 \times \text{cost}-0.1518 \times \text{cost}&=-\$3.905 +\$4.498\\[15 pt]
51.9132\times \text{cost}&=\$0.593
\end{aligned}$$

Divide both sides by $51.9132$ to get the value for break-even cost for the kilowatt-hour rate:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Cost}&=\dfrac{\$0.593}{51.9132}\\[15 pt]
&=\$0.01142
\end{aligned}$$

The break-even cost per kilowatt-hour is $\$0.01142$. This means that at this value, there is no difference between the incandescent light bulb and the LED light bulb.
